blocks.subject: RE: Pemex Guaranty - Enron
text: Martha:

Thanks for getting the changes to the form of guaranty approved.  Will you please have the guaranty dated effective as of January 1, 2001?  Also, who will be the party signing the guaranty, and when can we expect to receive the signed guaranty?  In addition, when  the guaranty has been signed on your part, will you please fax a copy to me at (713) 646-3490?
Again, thank you for your assistance on this.
Marie
Marie Heard
Senior Legal Specialist
Enron North America Corp.
marie.heard@enron.com

blocks.subject: RE: Pemex Guaranty - Enron
raw_header: To:	Breslau, Craig; Ortiz, Lucy; Heard, Marie
Cc:	crax1504@pmicim.com; frosenzweig@dca.pemex.com; gpfx2303@pmicim.com; mmax1805@pmicim.com; rhinojosa@dcf.pemex.com; xantonio@dca.pemex.com
text: Marie:
Our Corporate Lawyers just agreed to your suggested addition to the
Recitals Section.  In order to be able to execute the Guaranty we need
the final blessing of Hacienda, which should be no problem and is
already in process.  Carlos Riveroll contacting you to reach an
agreement regarding the Amendment to the MSA to incorporate the
Guaranty. In the mean time we will prepare the execution copyes be
ready to sign it.
Best regards,
Martha Navarro

blocks.subject: RE: Pemex Guaranty - Enron
raw_header: Sent: Viernes, 21 de Septiembre de 2001 04:55 p.m.
text: Ms. Navarro:
Thank you for sending your comments to the guaranty.  Please note our
comments below.
Marie Heard
Senior Legal Specialist
Enron North America Corp.

blocks.subject: Pemex Guaranty - Enron
raw_header: To:     Breslau, Craig; Ortiz, Lucy; Heard, Marie
text: Lucy:
Following please find our Corporate Lawyers comments to the changes
you
requested to the Guaranty we are working on:
1.      Recitals.  We do not see why it would be necessary to add
that
"The Guarantor will directly or indirectly benefit from the
Transactions between the Beneficiary and PMI".  Please explain.
[Heard,
Marie]    Because (i) it is a correct statement and (ii) it clarifies
the element of consideration which is essential for purposes of
enforceability.
2.      Section 1.  Considering that Pemex normally needs 5 business
days to request funds in foreing currencies to the Central Bank, we
need to change the payment date to be 5 Business Days after receipt
of
the Payment Demand instead of 3 days. [Heard, Marie]    We are okay
with
this change.
3.      Section 6. Jurisdiction.  We think that New York
Jurisdiction is
a good option and probably the most experienced in terms of
derivatives
trading, and therefore we prefer to keep the "exclusive" jurisdiction
of any federal court sitting in the Borough of Manhattan. [Heard,
Marie]
We are okay with the "exclusive" jurisdiction.
The rest of your comments are acceptable to us.  Carlos Riveroll will
be sending you PMI?s comments to the amendment to the MSA, so we can
finalize this as soon as posible.
Best regards,
Martha Navarro
